reuo.resources.io

Class Entry

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuo.resources.io.Entry
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FontEntry, GumpEntry, LightEntry, SpeechEntry, TextureEntry

    public class Entry
extends java.lang.Object
    An entry into an index that describes meta-information about Resources. All entries contain information about the identifier, offset, and length of the resource. Since most entries include an "extra" field that is used for various reasons it has also been included

    Before version 1.5 of this class there where get methods for id, offset, length, and extra. These have now been ommited because these members have been made final and are now exposed as public.

    Author:
    Kristopher Ives, Lucas Green

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int extra
      Extra information stored in the index (optional)
      int id
      The identiier of the resource this entry is indexing
      int length
      The length (in bytes) of the resource
      long offset
      The offset (in bytes) in the data source for the resource

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Entry(int id, long offset, int length)
      The extra field is initialized to 0.
      Entry(int id, long offset, int length, int extra)
      An entry in the index for a resource identified by id at the given offset of length.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entry

        public Entry(int id,
     long offset,
     int length,
     int extra)
        An entry in the index for a resource identified by id at the given offset of length.
        Parameters:
        id - the resource identifier
        offset - the offset (in bytes) of the resource
        length - the length (in bytes) of the resource
        extra - any extra information stored in the index

      • Entry

        public Entry(int id,
     long offset,
     int length)
        The extra field is initialized to 0.
        Parameters:
        id - the resource identifier
        offset - the offset (in bytes) of the resource
        length - the length (in bytes) of the resource

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks if entry in the index is valid. If the entry is not valid the resource should not be loaded. Extending classes may override this method as needed, but the default implementaiton ensures that offset >= 0 && length > 0
        Returns:
        true if and only if the entry is valid
